title: Queen Elizabeth II Records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Queen Elizabeth II Records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records, documents, notes, memos, communications, cases, files, information pertaining to Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom (Elizabeth Alexandra Mary Windsor).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noah

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1561546-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: David P. Schippers

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David P. Schippers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning David P. Schippers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

We are in receipt of your Freedom of Information Act request for information 
pertaining to David Phillip Schippers, Jr.  The Federal Bureau of

tracking number DCSA-B 23-08610.

Sincerely,

Melissa Velte
Government Information Specialist
Freedom of Information and Privacy Office for Investigations
Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency
724-794-7185
melissa.l.velte.civ@mail.mil

communications.subject: FOIA Request (DCSA)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon



This is in reference to your original FOIA request received in our office from 
another agency. I have finalized your request and will release the file using 
DoD SAFE (Secure Access File Exchange). Please expect to receive an email 
notification from DoD SAFE, which is reliant upon

system/personnel availability. However, notification should take no longer 
than 24 hours.



The Passphrase required to access your file is: FOIADCSA-08610



Once transmitted, you will have seven (7) days to retrieve the material.





James R. Delmar

Government Information Specialist, Records Dissemination

Privacy, Civil Liberties, and Freedom of Information

Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency

1137 Branchton Road

Boyers, PA 16018

Office: (724) 794-5612 x4463

james.r.delmar.civ@mail.mil

communications.subject: [DoD SAFE] DELMAR.JAMES.R has dropped off a file for you
communications.communication:
*** DO NOT FORWARD *** This is an automated message sent to you by the DoD SAFE service. DELMAR.JAMES.R has dropped off a file for you. IF YOU TRUST THE SENDER, and are expecting to receive a file from them, you may choose to retrieve the drop-off by clicking the following link (or copying and pasting it into your web browser): https://safe.apps.mil/pickup.php?claimID=qtjF3DKM9Ks6JhQq&recipCode=aZZEev ** This drop-off is encrypted. **
To download any files you must have the correct passphrase, which you can only get from the sender. You have 7 days to retrieve the drop-off; after that the link above will expire. If you wish to contact the sender, just reply to this email. The sender has left you a note: Please refer to the previous e-mail sent to you for your passphrase to access the file. Thank you. Full information about the drop-off: Claim ID: qtjF3DKM9Ks6JhQq Recipient Code: aZZEev Claim Passcode: x4NRNA3pZnJvafTC Drop-off Submitted: 2023-06-29 18:31:14 UTC Drop-off Completed: 2023-06-29 18:31:18 UTC -- Sender -- Name: DELMAR.JAMES.R Organization: DCSA Email Address: james.r.delmar.civ@mail.mil -- File -- Name: 23-08610 Best Requester Packet.pdf Size: 45407797 SHA-256 Checksum: 5E99969AD3B4790A4778D7000A7340FBBF8B68CD32668E07483025A41812C0B5 Content Type: application/pdf NOTICE: This e-mail message is intended solely for the use of the addressee. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any reading, dissemination, distribution, copying, or other use of this message or its attachments is strictly prohibited. title: FOIA - Murray Gell-Mann (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - Murray Gell-Mann (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records pertaining to and/or mentioning Murray Gell-Mann (September 15, 1929 – May 24, 2019) - American physicist who received the 1969 Nobel Prize in Physics for his work on the theory of elementary particles.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: FBI vexsome filer list

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI vexsome filer list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent copy of the "vexsome filer list" which may also be known as a "High Volume Requestors" list, "serial filer list" or a "nuisance filer list." Include any other list of FOIA requesters used by your agency which lists FOIA requesters because of the quantity or type of FOIA requests they have submit or any other FOIA related behavior. Please include any FBI or DOJ originated materials describing the list, its purpose, its meaning, and/or how it is used.

I am a member of the press and request classification as such.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 8, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #1489612-000.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1489612-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

COVID-19 Impact: RIDS resumed full staffing on April 12, 2021.  Commensurate with the return of full staffing levels, RIDS will being increasing its FOIA processing production.  While RIDS will make its best efforts to meet increased production goals, this increased production rate may be negatively impacted by COVID-19 workplace disruptions.  As a result, estimated dates of completion for Freedom of Information Act requests were impacted and you can expect lengthened response timelines.  Please note that these are estimates, and these timelines may change as this national emergency evolves.  The FBI remains committed to fulfilling your FOIPA request in the timeliest manner possible.   Thank you for your patience and understanding.

title: Hal Finney

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hal Finney
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files and emails relating to or mentioning Harold Thomas Finney II (May 4, 1956 – August 28, 2014), AKA Hal Finney.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: FBI Alerts and Advisories

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Alerts and Advisories
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the following records:

FBI FLASH
* Trickbot Banking Trojan Targets US Institutions and Maximizes Profits through SMB Propagation or Ransomware (Oct. 2018) 
* Brute Force Attack Likely Leveraged to Attempt Access to City Government’s FTP Server (Aug. 2018) 
* Cyber Actors Targeting Small Office and Home Office Routers  (May 2018)
* Ongoing Cyber Espionage Campaign  (April 2018) 

FBI Private Industry Notification
* Cyber Insider Threat Actors Disrupt Networks and Steal Data   (April 2019)
* Cyber Actors Use Desktop Sharing Software to Victimize US Businesses  (April 2019)
* Cyber Threats in Response to the Designation of the Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps  (April 2019)
* Cyber Criminals Steal Funds from Retirement and Spending Accounts through Unauthorized Online Access (March 2019)
* Cyber Criminals Exploit Cardless ATM Feature of Mobile Banking Applications  (March 2019) 
* Cyber Criminals Targeted Web Browser Extension Developers to Distribute Malware​  (Jan. 2019)
* Cyber Actors Target Audio and Visual Communication Devices on Business Networks to Identify Vulnerabilities for Exploitation​  (Jan. 2019)
* Anticipatory Awareness on Cyber Security for Smart Buildings​ ​ (Dec. 2018)
* Cyber Criminals Likely Using Internet Query Files in Phishing Campaigns Targeting US Businesses​  (Dec. 2018)
* Web Injection Attacks Pose Immediate Threat to e-Commerce and Financial Institutions by Skimming Credit Card Information  (Nov. 2018)
* Cyber Criminals Likely to Shift Toward Sophisticated Small-Scale, Targeted Campaigns Cryptocurrency Mining (Oct. 2018) 
* Update to North Korean Cyber Threats to US Private Industry  (Oct. 2018) January 2018 Alert 
* Cyber Actors Using Emotet and/or Trickbot Malware to Deploy Ransomware   (Oct. 2018) 
* “Unlimited Operation” Schemes Pose an Immediate Threat to Financial Institutions  (Aug. 2018) 
* Cybercriminals Utilize Social Engineering Techniques to Obtain Employee Credentials to Conduct Payroll Diversion  (Aug. 2018)
* BEC Actors Conduct Reconnaissance by Phone to Increase Effectiveness of Campaigns   (July 2018)
* Continued Iranian Cyber Threats to US Private Industry   (May 2018)
* ATM Jackpotting   (Feb. 2018)
* Recent WannaCry Attribution to North Korea Demonstrates Persistent Cyber Targeting of US Interests (Jan.2018) Members Only
* Cyber Criminal Group Threatens Schools and Students​ ​ (Jan. 2018)
* Recent WannaCry Attribution to North Korea Demonstrates Persistent Cyber Targeting of US Interests  (Jan. 2018) 
* Enduring North Korean Cyber Threats to US Private Industry   (Jan. 2018)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Alerts and Advisories
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Pittsburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good Morning Sydnee,

All of the City of Pittsburg Police Department’s (“Department”) policy manuals, both historical and most current, are available to the public to view and download for free on the NextRequest public records platform https://pittsburgcapd.nextrequest.com/  Click on the NextRequest link, click on Documents, in the Filter by folder field select Policy Manual, and click on Apply filters.  This will bring up all of the Department’s policy manuals, “2023 January – Pittsburg PD Policy Manual” being the most current.  You can then click on the document to view it and/or download it, free of charge.

Should you have any questions about this matter, please reach out to me.

Sincerely,

[Description: cid:image003.png@01D71A78.902EC1A0]

Cady R. Richards
Records Supervisor
Pittsburg Police Department
65 Civic Avenue
Pittsburg, CA  94565
(925) 252-4889  Fax (925) 252-4882


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This communication with its contents may contain confidential and/or legally privileged information.  It is solely for the use of the intended recipient(s).  Unauthorized interception, review, use or disclosure is prohibited and may violate applicable laws, including the Electronic Communications Privacy Act.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender and destroy all copies of the communication.

***Please note that our City email domain has changed.  As such, my email address is now crichards@pittsburgca.gov<mailto:crichards@pittsburgca.gov>.  Please update your records.  Thank you.***

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Liaison Alert System Reports list (2015)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Network Breach and Cyber Attack Records (2018-Present)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Network Breach and Cyber Attack Records (2018-Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Jordan Lassiter
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 13, 2023

North Salem Central School District
230 June Road
North Salem, NY 10560

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records Pertaining to Network Breaches or Cyber Attacks

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the New York Freedom of Information Law, Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by North Salem Central School District pertaining to:

1) Any network breaches or cyber-attacks that have occurred within your organization, including any records of unauthorized access, data theft, or system compromise from January 1, 2018 to the present.

2) Any internal investigations or reviews conducted in response to a suspected or confirmed network breach, including any reports, findings, or recommendations.

3) Any incident response plans or policies in place to address network breaches, including any procedures for mitigating and remediating the effects of such incidents.

4) Any communications between your organization and affected individuals, customers, or partners regarding network breaches or incidents.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with the New York Freedom of Information Law. If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log.

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation.

I also request a waiver of all fees in connection with this request as disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within five business days.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

communications.subject: Re: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Network Breach and Cyber Attack Records (2018-Present)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Lassiter,


This will serve as a preliminary response to your Freedom of Information
Law request, received here on June 14, 2023.


The Freedom of Information Law requires public bodies to make
reasonably-identified existing documents available for inspection and
copying, but does not require research or narrative responses.  Accordingly,
we will not be responding to those inquiries where the information is not
available to you from existing documents.


You will be notified via email once we have the requested records available
for review in our office.

If you wish to receive copies by mail, you will be invoiced in accordance
with our purchasing policy for postage reimbursement and a copy charge of
$0.25 per page.

Should you have any questions, feel free to contact me at (914) 669-5414
extension 1012.


To the extent that access to any record has been denied, you may appeal
such denial in writing within thirty days after your receipt of this
letter.

Your appeal should be addressed to Dr. Kenneth R. Freeston, Superintendent
of Schools, 230 June Road, North Salem, NY 10560.





Sincerely,


Eric M. Stark

Records Access Officer

-- 
*______________________*
This message may contain confidential information 
and is intended only for the individual(s) named. If you are not an 
intended recipient you are not authorized to disseminate, distribute or 
copy this e-mail. Please notify the sender immediately if you have received 
this e-mail by mistake and delete this e-mail from your system.

title: New Mexico Livestock and Animal Mutilations

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico Livestock and Animal Mutilations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request any and all files in connection with animal or livestock mutilations from 1967 through 2022. I believe these records are under the purview of the New Mexico Livestock Board.

As a citizen of the United States, I am entitled to access public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I request that you provide me with copies of all records, documents, notes, reports, and any other material related to animal or livestock mutilations that have been investigated by the New Mexico Livestock Board from January 1, 1967, to December 31, 2022.

Please provide me with any available information regarding the following:

The number of reported animal or livestock mutilations in New Mexico from 1967 to 2022.
The locations of the reported animal or livestock mutilations.
The number of investigations launched into these incidents.
The results of the investigations, including any reports, conclusions, or findings.
If there are any fees associated with fulfilling this request, please inform me in advance. I would appreciate a response to this request within 20 business days, as required by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Records Request Received - Request ID: 3869
communications.communication:
Dear Nathan Isaac,

Please find a link below with records responsive to your request.

Request 3869 5-11-2023<https://www.nmlbonline.com/maildoc.php?id=103710&guid=DBEF12CE-725A-17F8-BCDD-00133B21A438>

The bodycam footage for the report exceeds 2 GBs. Please advise if you wish to receive these large files by one of the following methods:


  *   We can prepare multiple CDs and deliver in one package by USPS mail or pickup at the front desk for a $5 fee.
  *   We can prepare a USB external drive and deliver by USPS mail or pickup at the front desk for a $10 fee.
  *   You can arrange for a time to bring your own new/unopened USB external drive and we will copy all of the data to that at no charge.

We do anticipate more bodycam video that may be responsive to your request. With that in mind we can wait until the entirety of the bodycam video is collected and then provide it in one lump sum. Please indicate if you would like us to do that or if you would prefer the video be made available as it is processed.

We require more time to search for any additional responsive records, until May 18, 2023.

Daniel Trujillo

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Palicki emails 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All emails From: and To: Rosemary Palicki from January 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-The records previously released to the Athens Banner-Herald pursuant to a ruling and subsequent agreement made between that newspaper and the University of Georgia Athletic Association in Clarke County Superior Court, case SU21CV0558.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Landon Edwards

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Georgia Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 15, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: NIL records (23-139)
communications.communication:
Mr. Edwards—



This is to acknowledge receipt of your March 15, 2023, request for documents under the Georgia Open Records Act, and is in accordance with the three-day period of response pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(b)(2).



You have requested “The records previously released to the Athens Banner-Herald pursuant to a ruling and subsequent agreement made between that newspaper and the University of Georgia Athletic Association in Clarke County Superior Court, case SU21CV0558.”



Because you have requested records of the University’s intercollegiate sports program, I have forwarded it to the University’s Athletic Department for an assessment of the scope of potentially responsive documents, estimation of the costs to search for and produce responsive records, and consideration of potentially applicable exemptions.



A written response to your request will arrive within the time-period specified in O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(d.1).



Regards,


Bob Taylor
Division of Marketing & Communications
Open Records Manager
Hodgson Oil Building, Suite 200 N | 286 Oconee St. | Athens, GA 30602
706-542-8090 | btaylor@uga.edu<mailto:btaylor@uga.edu> | www.uga.edu<http://www.uga.edu/>
[University of Georgia]
[Facebook]<https://www.facebook.com/uga.edu> [Twitter] <https://twitter.com/universityofga>  [Instagram] <https://www.instagram.com/universityofga/>  [Linkedin] <https://www.linkedin.com/edu/school?id=18190>  [Youtube] <https://www.youtube.com/uga>  [Snapchat] <https://www.snapchat.com/add/university-ga>

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #23-139
communications.communication:
Mr. Taylor,

I respectfully challenge the determination you have made in processing my request. While I am requesting records that originated with the University's intercollegiate sports program, I am of the belief that such records are in the custody of the Open Records Manager. 

Upon information and belief, your office retains records of public records requests received and *your office's responses to each request, including any records disclosed to the requestor*, for 3 years, in compliance with the University System of Georgia's record retention policy. 

The Athens Banner-Herald previously requested certain University of Georgia Athletic Association (UGAA) records on August 2, 2021 (#21-371). On November 2, 2021, you denied this request. In October 2022, the Athens Banner-Herald made a "Renewed Open Records Request" directly to the UGAA. This request was fulfilled in March 2023 pursuant to court order. 

It is unclear if your office is responsible for retaining records relating to the ABH's October 2022 request. If your office does currently hold these records, you have incorrectly claimed that my request falls under the scope of O.C.G.A. § 50-18-71(d.1), and I would ask that you process my request under the standard parameters of the Georgia Open Records Act. 

I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Landon Edwards

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request #23-139

This is a follow-up and final response to your Open Records Act request for “The records previously released to the Athens Banner-Herald pursuant to a ruling and subsequent agreement made between that newspaper and the University of Georgia Athletic Association in Clarke County Superior Court, case SU21CV0558.”



With respect to your request, please find the attached responsive files.



Regards,


Bob Taylor

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Great Neck Public Schools)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Great Neck Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Council on School Health (COSH), including any communications or correspondence between the school district and these organizations, or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

To help identify responsive records, you can limit your time period to 1/1/2017 until the date of final response; also I request that you search for the following terms, which are focused on the American Academy of Pediatrics and its affiliated organizations:

"American Academy of Pediatrics"
"AAP"
"Council on School Health"
"COSH"
"pediatric"
"child health"
"school health"

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence between the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Council on School Health, and the school district or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Great Neck Public Schools)
communications.communication:
I am writing in response to your recent communications regarding my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request dated March 7, 2023. I appreciate your efforts in identifying over 16,000 emails that may be potentially responsive to my request. However, I would like to clarify a few points to ensure a comprehensive and compliant response to my request.

Firstly, I understand that the identified emails need to be reviewed to determine which ones contain potential education records and which ones do not, as per Public Officers Law 87(2)(a) and 20 U.S.C. 1232g, or interagency documents under Public Officers Law 87(2)(g). I also acknowledge that certain emails may be precluded from disclosure under Public Officers Law §87(2)(a) (C.P.L.R. §3101(c), and C.P.L.R. §4503(a)). However, it is important to note that these regulations do not necessitate the wholesale removal of emails. Rather, they require specific redactions of sensitive information while leaving intact factual or other information that aligns with relevant redaction scopes.

In light of this, I would like to request that the School District ensures that redactions are specific and do not result in the removal of entire emails that contain responsive factual information not covered under the exemptions mentioned. The redaction process should be conducted in a manner that respects the principles of transparency and accountability, as outlined in the New York State Freedom of Information Law.

Secondly, I would like to clarify that the 16,000 emails identified are indeed responsive to my request. The wording in your response suggests a conflation between the terms "responsive" and "redacted". I understand that the School District is reviewing these emails to determine which ones require further redaction, not to determine their responsiveness.

Lastly, I would like to request a rolling response to my FOIL request. Given the large number of emails identified, it would be beneficial to receive the emails in batches as they are reviewed and redacted, rather than waiting for the entire batch to be processed. This would allow for a more timely and efficient review of the information.

I appreciate your attention to these matters and look forward to your continued cooperation in fulfilling my FOIL request. Please feel free to contact me if you require any further clarification or information.

title: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all electronic communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, sent or received by the following individuals for the period of time between July 1, 2022 and May 16, 2023:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

Please provide me with copies of all such communications in electronic format, preferably in a searchable PDF or text file. 

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

I am requesting these records in order to conduct research on a matter of public interest. I believe that these records will be helpful in understanding the activities of these individuals and their impact on the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PAC Bellevue

communications.subject: New Request for Records / PRR 05162023-Anon
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

We have received your May 17, 2023 request for public records and have assigned it tracking number PRR 05162023-Anon.

I understand your request to be:


I request all electronic communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, sent or received by the following individuals for the period of time between July 1, 2022 and May 16, 2023:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

Please provide me with copies of all such communications in electronic format, preferably in a searchable PDF or text file.

A clarification question: Are you requesting communications sent/received only between these five staff members, between a subset of the five or all communications sent/received by these employees to/from any source?

The latter search will take considerably longer than the former because – for email communications alone – these staff members appear in tens of thousands of messages annually. For example, during the identified time period, Eva Collins appears in the “to” and/or “from” fields of 23,943 emails. We will need to review each email to check for protected information (such as student identifiers or privileged legal communications). The same will apply to the other forms of electronic communications.

I want to get you what you’re looking for as quickly and efficiently as possible. Perhaps we could break this request into pieces and work on one piece at a time? If you like, we could search first for communications sent/received between these five employees and produce those records to you. We can then move through the remainder of the request in whatever order you prefer. Please let me know if this approach would be acceptable to you.

I have begun identifying potentially responsive email records. Once we hear back from you about the desired scope of your request and your preferred method for organizing our search, I will provide you with an anticipated date for our first production of records.
Best regards,

Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
As for your suggestion to break down this request, we find this acceptable.

To provide further clarification, the first part of the request is for any electronic communication between these individuals that includes at least one of the mentioned individuals in either the "to", "cc", or "from" fields.

Once this part of the request is fulfilled, we would like to receive all communications as initially requested for these individuals. We would like these records to be provided in reverse chronological order, beginning with the most recent. In terms of priority, we would prefer to receive the records for each individual separately, following this order:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

We believe this will ensure we receive the required information in a prompt manner. We look forward to your timely response and appreciate your assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

Thank you very much for your response and clarifications. In keeping with your directions, I’ve run the following email archive search:


  *   All emails sent on or after July 1, 2022 & on or before May 16, 2023
  *   Where the “to”, “cc”, or “from” fields contain any of the following email addresses:

JarvisA@bsd405.org
DevitaM@bsd405.org
AramakiK@bsd405.org
CollinsE@bsd405.org
McminimeeS@bsd405.org

This search returns 349,698 messages:
[cid:image001.png@01D99465.4588EEF0]

I’m happy to pull those messages and begin the review process but it will take a very long time to complete this production.

With the understanding that, at your direction, we will begin review on the 349,698-message production, would you be willing to start with the following search:


  *   All emails sent on or after July 1, 2022 & on or before May 16, 2023
  *   Where the “to”, “cc”, or “from” fields contain any all of the following email addresses:

JarvisA@bsd405.org<mailto:JarvisA@bsd405.org>
DevitaM@bsd405.org<mailto:DevitaM@bsd405.org>
AramakiK@bsd405.org<mailto:AramakiK@bsd405.org>
CollinsE@bsd405.org<mailto:CollinsE@bsd405.org>
McminimeeS@bsd405.org<mailto:McminimeeS@bsd405.org>

This search returns 1,006 messages:
[cid:image002.png@01D99468.02553AF0]

While it will still take some time to review and prep each email for the above search, having a much smaller starting batch will help us get you a complete production as quickly as possible.

Apologies for the lengthy email – I just want you to have all the information so you can make the decision about where we start. As noted above, you can at any point let me know when/if you want to change the direction of our productions. I will begin working on the 1,006-message search now in order to get things moving. Please let me know if this is an acceptable starting-point or if you’d prefer another search for our initial production. If the 1,006-message batch is our agreed starting place, I anticipate that we will have a first installment of records ready on or before July 14, 2023. If records are available sooner, I will provide them to you.
Best,
Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
Hi Sarah,

Thanks for the detailed update - it's much appreciated. I wanted to clarify that we are looking for electronic communications that include any one (or more) of the five named individuals in the "to", "cc", or "from" fields, not necessarily all five at once. We get that this makes for a lot of messages, but it's what we need for our inquiry. Let's stick with the plan of tackling this in chunks and going in reverse chronological order. This seems like the most practical approach given the volume of records.

One more thing: will the search include other forms of electronic communication apart from emails? For instance, we would be interested in instant messages from Microsoft Teams if they're available.

Looking forward to your response and hearing about the next steps. Thanks again for your work on this.

Best,
PAC Bellevue

It seems there might be a small misunderstanding in how we are defining the scope of the request. We initially intended our request to be focused as follows:

We are looking for electronic communications where at least one of the named individuals is in the "from" field, and at least one of them is also in either the "to" or "cc" fields. Our original revision was meant to capture this — we don't need every single message where these individuals are present, but those messages where they are directly communicating with each other. This approach should narrow down the search considerably compared to any communication where these individuals are merely included.

Additionally, could you confirm if other forms of electronic communication like instant messages, specifically from Microsoft Teams, will be included in this search?

Thanks for bearing with us and helping clarify these details.

communications.subject: 1st Installment / PRR 05162023-Anon
communications.communication:
PRR 05162023-Anon

Dear Requestor:

Using the link below, please find our first production installment of records responsive to your May 16, 2023 request. This production contains 122 email messages (503 pages) sent from Superintendent Jarvis to Melissa Devita from January 1, 2023 to May 16, 2023:

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/e7vuam8pmx6g689nr88vy/Jarvis-to-Devita-1.1.23_5.16.23-122-msgs-_Redacted.pdf?rlkey=168h1tpyisuwhvdfdtze9oy5o&dl=0
(Please let me know if you have any trouble accessing the records in this format.)

No records have been withheld or exempted from this production. In keeping with our obligations under the Public Records Act, which exempts information identifying students and/or parents [RCW 42.56.230(1) & 42.56.070(1)], we have redacted student/parent names, email addresses and phone numbers from these records. As communications between attorneys and clients are also exempt from production [RCW 42.56.070(1) & RCW 5.60.060(2)(a)], some portions of emails containing those communications have been redacted. Every redaction has been marked with a code corresponding to the attached redaction information sheet. The sheet provides additional information about the basis for each redaction.

I continue to work on responsive emails sent during the period of January 1, 2023 to May 16, 2023 and anticipate that our next installment of records will be ready on or before September 1, 2023. If records are available sooner, I will provide them to you. Please let me know if you have any questions or if, at any point, you would like me to shift the focus of my productions – always happy to do so.
Best,
Sarah

title: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information:

A complete list of all employees, their job titles, and their annual salary for the last Three years (2020 and 2023).

Please provide all training documents related to the use of force within the agency, including but not limited to manuals, protocols, guidelines, and any related memos or communications.
I am making this FOIA request with any and all agencies that may have the requested information.

The purpose of this request is to gather information that will aid in a research project examining agency practices related to the use of force. The information requested will be used to assess the extent to which agency training on the use of force has been effective. This research project is being conducted as part of a larger effort to promote greater accountability and transparency within law enforcement agencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022.

Via email: public.records@eatonville.wednet.edu

To whom it may concern,

WASHINGTON STATE OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION - EQUITY AND CIVIL RIGHTS (https://www.k12.wa.us/policy-funding/equity-and-civil-rights):

"The Washington State legislature notes that schools should be a place in which all youth feel safe. With racial equity as a central component of safety and security planning, it is imperative that all school safety and security staff not contribute to an unsafe environment for Black youth and youth of color."

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

Note: If your agency chooses not to produce the requested records in reverse chronological order as requested, and/or chooses to sandbag this request by dribbling out a few records per installment every 6 months (tee-hee), you can expect a separate targeted public records request for each line item by year - submitted via multiple members of the public, multiple times until the requested records are timely produced. This simple three part multi year request would then become twelve (12) separate public records requests. If your agency would prefer 12 separate individual requests, please let us know.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

"You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you
are and change the ending." - C.S. Lewis

communications.communication:
July 13th, 2023

TO: 137002-48948558@requests.muckrock.com

RE:  PRR 2223-004 - “School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and
Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and
Agreements for the

Years 2019-2022”

To whom it may concern:

This letter serves as notification that on November 18th, 2023 you were
sent a response letter in regards to the public records request that our
office has identified as 2223-004. Our office has located any and all
records that we have interpreted as being responsive to your
request. Please see our replies to your questions in blue writing.


1. “Provide a complete copy of your agency's School Safety and Security
Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the
Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022,
2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.”

The school Safety and Security Data Collection Report has only been
collected by OSPI for the school years 2021-2022 and 2022-2023. Our office
has verified this with OSPI and OSPI has provided Eatonville School
District’s responses as submitted for the Safety and Security Data
Collection Report for 2021-2022 and 2022-2023. We have these two reports
that OSPI has made available to us ready to release to you.

2. “Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your
agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School
Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.”

Eatonville School District did not have any contracts and/or agreements
with any law enforcement organization or agency for the school years 2022,
2021, 2020, and 2019.

3.)”Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and
all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security
Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or
noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to
provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years
2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.”

2022: Joe Reed, 360-879-1200,  j.reed@eatonville.wednet.edu

2021: Eatonville School District employed no employees or contractors whose
primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for our agency

2020: Eatonville School District employed no employees or contractors whose
primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for our agency

2019: Eatonville School District employed no employees or contractors whose
primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for our agency

I have attached copies of Eatonville School District’s responses for the
2022-2023 and 2021-2022 School Safety and Security Data collection report
that OSPI has retrieved and provided to us to fulfill your request to this
email. This communication concludes the request for records, file number
PRR 2223-004. We now consider this request officially closed.If you have

Sincerely,



Ashley Farrens

Public Records Officer

360.879.1000

title: Hospital discharge data (Department of Health Services)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Hospital discharge data (Department of Health Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Complete hospital discharge data surrounding all of the following procedures - Amputations, Endovascular procedures (therapeutic) and/or Open bypass surgery -- specifically relating to Type II diabetes and/or Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) broken down by hospital name, gender, race, total charges, total costs, address and zip code. 

I request this data be separated by year between 2017 and 2022, or the last available data.

The excel, csv, or pdf file could look as follows:
Procedure, hospital name, year, gender, race, total charges, total costs, address, zip code.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I would also prefer any fees be waived as I am a member of the nonprofit media, and this information will serve the public. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Aarushi Sahejpal

communications.subject: Response: June 9, 2023 (Hospital Discharge Data)
communications.communication:
In response to your June 9, 2023 public records request regarding certain
hospital discharge data, please note that we have procedure laid out on our
website to request limited datasets, which can be found here
<https://www.azdhs.gov/preparedness/public-health-statistics/hospital-discharge-data/index.php#data-release>.
In addition, public queries regarding certain hospital related data can be
made through HCUPnet
<http://hcupnet.ahrq.gov/HCUPnet.jsp?Id=2C48E9EC13227BCB&Form=MAINSEL&JS=Y&Action=%253E%253ENext%253E%253E&_MAINSEL=State%20Statistics>.
For more information about hospital and patient information, please visit
our website
<https://www.azdhs.gov/preparedness/public-health-statistics/hospital-discharge-data/index.php#hospital-patient-statistics-home>
to
find more useful tools, tips, and resources regarding reporting requirements
<https://www.azdhs.gov/preparedness/public-health-statistics/hospital-discharge-data/index.php#reporting-requirements-home>.
Please also note that certain data is confidential pursuant to A.R.S.
36-2220
<https://www.azleg.gov/viewdocument/?docName=https://www.azleg.gov/ars/36/02220.htm>
and
that public records law does not require an agency to create a new record,
answer questions or tally/compile previously untallied/un-compiled
information or data to fulfill a public records request. Thank you for your
inquiry.

-- 

Office of Administrative Counsel and Rules

Arizona Department of Health Services

150 N. 18th Ave., Suite 200, Phoenix, AZ 85007

Phone: 602.542.1020

Fax: 602.364.1150

*Health and Wellness for all Arizonans*

-- 
CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This e-mail is the property of the Arizona 
Department of Health Services and contains information that may be 
PRIVILEGED, CONFIDENTIAL, or otherwise exempt from disclosure by applicable 
law.  It is intended only for the person(s) to whom it is addressed.  If 
you have received this communication in error, please do not retain or 
distribute it.  Please notify the sender immediately by e-mail at the 
address shown above and delete the original message.  Thank you.
